meanings.definition: A person who brings a libel suit in court.
meanings.sent1: The libelants presented their case in front of the judge.
meanings.sent2: The libelants filed a lawsuit against the newspaper for defamation.
meanings.sent3: The libelants walked confidently into the courtroom, ready to defend their reputation.
meanings.sent4: The libelants stood tall, like warriors fighting for their honor.
meanings.sent5: The faces of the libelants showed determination and resolve as they sought justice.

meanings.sent1: In the legal document, it stated that the libelants were seeking damages.
meanings.sent2: The libelants gathered evidence to support their claim of defamation.
meanings.sent3: As the libelants entered the room, all eyes turned towards them.
meanings.sent4: The group of libelants stood united, ready to fight for their rights.
meanings.sent5: The voices of the libelants echoed in the courtroom, demanding justice.
